title: Qizilbash
summary: Qizilbash or Kizilbash (Ottoman Turkish: قزيل باش‎; Turkish: Kızılbaş, lit. 'Red head' Turkish pronunciation: [kɯzɯɫbaʃ]; Azerbaijani: Qızılbaş, Persian: قزلباش‎, romanized: Qezelbāš) were a diverse array of mainly Turkoman[1] Shia militant groups that flourished in Iranian Azerbaijan,[2][3] Anatolia and Kurdistan from the late 15th century onwards, and contributed to the foundation of the Safavid dynasty of Iran.[4][5]
